alert.note: Alert for Bowie; Cass (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Little River, southwestern Hempstead, Miller, northwestern Lafayette, eastern Cass and southeastern Bowie Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 338 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ogden to 7 miles north of Queen City to near Linden. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Hope, Atlanta, Wake Village, Nash, Linden, Queen City, Redwater, Red Lick, Fouke, Garland, Fulton, Ogden, Bivins, Mandeville, Ravanna, Genoa, Brightstar, Fairview and Leary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...and northeastern Texas.
